comment: The best professor I have had so far. Cares about her students and knows what she is teaching.

Professor Sharma is highly invested in all of her students. She takes academics very seriously, but she strives for her students to improve and learn. She has a sarcastic, dry sense of humor, and once you get to know her you will LOVE her! My pro tip would be to communicate with her, and you will be very happy with your experience and the outcome.

Class is mostly an audit simulation, she is a pretty decent instructor but seemed disinterested in lecturing generally, preferring to just hit key concepts and then have us work on the audit simulation, which has mandatory attendance.
Dr. Sharma was one of the kindest and best professors I have had at KSU. Totally recommend her!

Clearly spent time in Britain and Australia - dry sense of humor which I loved. She is very caring and walks the class through all the work that she is able to for the group project. In addition, she bends over backwards to accommodate.

She's a really good professor. Some people complained and said otherwise, but it's a hard class that they probably just weren't cut out for. Her lectures are effective, and she responds to emails quickly, unlike some Professors. Auditing is really an interesting concept, and Dr. Sharma did an excellent job of showing that.

One group project, lets you use class time for it and helps you. Three tests, gives you a study guide. Review questions for text are helpful. She's funny, never took attendance, but I enjoyed going to her class. Gives chapter crossword puzzles for extra credit. Tests are difficult but doable, just put in the time.
Very nice and understanding. Sometimes has trouble conveying material. Group project and three tests. Gives extra credit.

Dr. Sharma is a wonderful person, however, her tests are the worst. Her first exam was over 6 chapters, which means that you basically are unable to comprehend everything, requiring you to just memorize. I'm a straight A student and will more than likely get a B in this class, as I have to make a 100% on the final to get an A.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: I really enjoyed Dr Sharma's class last semester. She is certainly an asset to KSU and I enjoyed having her as my professor!
This professor was so helpful and made a difficult course easy. Helped us so much with our group project.
The best I've had. Genuinely interested in students.
She's a charming, nice professor.  Some tests were difficult but she is a good professor and also has a good sense of humor.  Always willing to help students both inside and outside of class.
